statement.title: Content
statement.content: Given a positive integer $N$, you should output the most right digit of $N^N$.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content:
The input contains several test cases. The first line of the input is a single integer $T$ which is the number of test cases. $T$ test cases follow.

Each test case contains a single positive integer $N(1 \leq N \leq 1,000,000,000)$.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: For each test case, you should output the rightmost digit of $N^N$.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
2 3 47 6

statement.title: Note
statement.content:
In the first case, $3 \times 3  \times  3 = 27$, so the rightmost digit is $7$.

In the second case, $4 \times 4 \times 4 \times 4 = 256$, so the rightmost digit is $6$.
